de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup

Class SetupActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • de.awi.floenavigation.helperclasses.ActionBarActivity
              • de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup.SetupActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class SetupActivity
extends ActionBarActivity
    This Activity sets up the Coordinate System by calculating the angle DatabaseHelper.beta by using the two base stations (origin and x-Axis marker) inserted by the MMSIFragment and CoordinateFragment. Before setting up the coordinate system it runs the predictions for each station for atleast DatabaseHelper.initial_setup_time.

    The Activity runs predictions for each station using Timer objects. During each prediction it also calculates the difference between the prediction and the received values. Additionally it also calculates the Angle beta from the received coordinates and the predicted coordinates and calculates the difference between them as well.

    After the Timer object has run for DatabaseHelper.initial_setup_time, it inserts last updated values for the predicted coordinates of both station in the Database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable, the last calculated value of angle Beta (from the received coordinates) in the Database table DatabaseHelper.betaTable and start the background services which then do the same task as this activity in the background.

    The Activity layout shows the details such as MMSI number, received coordinates, predicted coordinates, and difference between the two coordinates for each station on the screen. It also shows the Angle Beta from received and predicted coordinates and its difference as well. It also show a circular ProgressBar to show how long the Prediction timer has been running for. Once the prediction timer ends it shows a Button

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  SetupActivity.InsertXAxisDistance
      An AsyncTask which is used to insert the distance between the origin and x-Axis marker as x coordinate of the x-Axis marker base station in the Database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable.
      private class  SetupActivity.ReadParamsFromDB
      An AsyncTask which runs in the background and reads and updates the values of the base stations (origin and x-Axis marker) from the database tabel DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable.

        private static final int JOB_ID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PREDICTION_TIME

        private static int PREDICTION_TIME
        Specifies how the total amount of time the Predictions will run for. Read from the Configuration Parameter DatabaseHelper.initial_setup_time Specifies the delay for parentTimer.

      • PREDICATION_TIME_PERIOD

        private static final int PREDICATION_TIME_PERIOD
        Specifies the interval for each prediction. Currently set to 10 seconds. Specifies the time period for timer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_TIMER_COUNT

        private static final int MAX_TIMER_COUNT
        Specifies the minimum number of times the Prediction timer (timer) has to run before it can be ended. It describes the absolute minimum number predictions that have to occur before the Setup Activity can end.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • toastMsg

        private static final java.lang.String toastMsg
        Toast message which is displayed in case back button is pressed. Back Button is displayed in this Activity.
        See Also:

        public static final java.lang.String calledFromCoordinateFragment
        String which specifies the key in the Bundle for whether the activity was started from CoordinateFragment
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • parentTimer

        java.util.Timer parentTimer
        Timer object which monitors the overall time for the Predictions. It starts with a Delay of PREDICTION_TIME and checks every 500 milliseconds if MAX_TIMER_COUNT number of Predictions have been done. If so, it stops both itself and the prediction timer timer, stops the circular progess bar and displays the Next Button on the screen.

      • timer

        java.util.Timer timer
        Timer object which runs every PREDICATION_TIME_PERIOD, it reads the current location of both the Origin and x-Axis marker, predicts new location of the stations, displays the received location, predicted location and their difference on the screen and updates the ProgressBar percentage.

        It runs until it is cancelled by parentTimer.

      • timerCounter

        private int timerCounter
        Counts the number of times the timer is run. As each run of timer is a new prediction this is effectively a count of the number of predictions.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Activity.onCreate(Bundle). Runs the Predictions for both base stations and creates the Floe's coordinate system by calculating the Angle DatabaseHelper.beta.

        Runs the timer which in its every run reads the latest received values from the Database of both base stations, predicts new latitude and longitude and calculates the difference in the predicted values with the received values. In each timer run it also creates the Floe's coordinate system (by calculatinig angle DatabaseHelper.beta) from the received coordinates and the predicted coordinates and the difference in the two Betas. It then refreshes the values on the screen at the end of each run of the timer.

        The second timer parentTimer starts running after a delay of PREDICTION_TIME and it checks the number of times timer has run. If timer has run more than MAX_TIMER_COUNT, it cancels both timers, inserts the last predicted values in Database and displays the Next button on the screen.

        Before running both timers for the first time it calculates the distance between the origin and x-Axis marker and inserts it as the DatabaseHelper.xPosition of the x-Axis marker in the database. It also runs the prediction and beta caclculation once outside the timer so that fields on the screen are populated with the inital values.

        Overrides:
        onCreate in class ActionBarActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • hideNavigationBar

        private void hideNavigationBar()
        Hides the Navigation Bar (containing the Back Button, Home Button etc) on the bottom of the screen

      • insertPredictedValuesInDB

        private boolean insertPredictedValuesInDB()
        Inserts the Predicted Latitude and Longitude of both the Origin and x-Axis marker in to the Database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable. Called at the end of the Predictions to insert the last predicted values in Database.
        Returns:
        true if inserted successfully.

      • retrievePredictionTimefromDB

        private void retrievePredictionTimefromDB()
        Retrieves the total amount of time the overall Prediction timer has to run for from the Database table DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable and sets it to PREDICTION_TIME

      • progressBarValueUpdates

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        Description copied from class: ActionBarActivity
        Creates the Action Bar icons on top of the screen. This method is overloaded with ActionBarActivity.onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu, int). This method shows the GPS icon, AIS Connectivity icon and the Grid Setup icon.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class ActionBarActivity

      • dialogBoxDisplay

        private void dialogBoxDisplay()

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem menuItem)
        Default handler for the Action Bar Option Menu of Change Lat/Lon View format. It inverts the value of changeFormat and updates its value in DatabaseHelper.configParametersTable so that the same format is shown throughout the App.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.app.Activity
